short_description: Token-service returns 401 because JWKS cache did not refresh after key rotation
description: After KMS key rotation, some services still use an old JWKS set. Tokens signed with new key-id are rejected. Affected endpoint: POST /v1/auth/introspect. Affected party: TPP:AccountAggregatorY.
caused_by: Change:KID-ROT-2026-01 / JWKS cache TTL too high

short_description: PSD2 mTLS authentication outage (handshake failures)
description: PSD2 token endpoint is failing because psd2-mtls cannot validate TPP certificates. API Gateway returns 502/503 on POST /v1/psd2/token. Business impact: TPP access blocked.
caused_by: CI:psd2-mtls / Deployment crashloop due to invalid truststore path in configmap

comments: TPPs report intermittent 401/403; logs show certificate status checks timing out (OCSP).
comments_and_work_notes: COMMENTS: TPPs report intermittent 401/403; logs show certificate status checks timing out (OCSP). || WORK_NOTES: Reviewed ocsp-client metrics; observed timeout spikes and cache misses; enabled OCSP response caching and warmup; tuned timeouts and circuit breaker; verified failure rate reduction.

short_description: PSD2 certificate validation degraded (OCSP timeouts)

caused_by: CI:ocsp-client / External OCSP responder latency + cache not warmed

short_description:
I apologize, but it seems like you didn't provide any relevant information or context for me to create a summarized and creative short description. The query "asd asd gffgfg hhg" doesn't seem to contain any meaningful details.

If you could provide more context or clarify what the query refers to (e.g., an incident, an event, a system error), I'd be happy to help you generate a concise and engaging short description for your incident report!
